heading: Latest Trends you could perceive with the BFS Technology
content1: According to a famous packaging consultant, the market size of the BFS technology is predicted to grow from 292.3 million USD in 2018 to reach 386.0 million USD in the year 2023. Way ahead, the technology has brought a new revolution in the healthcare and pharmaceutical packaging industry. While the packaging technique primarily involves blow molding, filling and sealing of containers at the same time, it ensures utmost sterility with less human intervention. This aspect makes it ideal for packaging semi-liquid and liquid solutions. Now, let’s look at the key market trends pertaining to the BFS technology.

qa.q: What are the key market trends reigning in 2023?
qa.a: As 2023 passes by, you could observe some market trends that will dominate sooner or later.

The BFS technology market has seen a significant adoption in the realm of pharmaceuticals. As the organizations package liquid medications, respiratory drugs and ophthalmic products, the technology is known for safeguarding the products and filling them in a sterile environment. Moreover, the technology maintains product integrity and extends the life span of different products.

qa.q: Increasing use for unit dose packaging
qa.a: With the prime concern for patient safety, unit dose packaging has now become prominent this year. As the technology drives the production of unit doses, it mitigates the risk of contamination and ensures the filling of the intended amount of the product. This trend is now considered extremely important when doctors are more concerned about patient care.

As business owners and consumers consider sustainability to be quite important, the Blow-Fill-Seal technology market has expressed a great response with eco-friendly packaging solutions. Manufacturers are now seeking recyclable materials for producing containers through the BFS technology. As they explore the materials, it’s done in sync with environmental stewardship and circular economy principles.

Diligent research and efforts in the BFS technology market has now led to the evolution in material compatibility. The technology can now drive everything seamlessly with a vast range of materials including co-extruded structures and numerous ploymers. Such a kind of versatility brings in new opportunities for packaging different items and formulations.

qa.q: What are the innovations that are driving the industry?
qa.a: The BFS technology market has been witnessing new innovations that are sure to enhance product efficiency. To streamline the overall production process, robotics and automation has now been incorporated in the entire packaging process. This minimizes the risk of contamination when there’s hardly any human intervention. Moreover, the evolution in the filling techniques have actually improved aseptic assurance on the whole.

As many packaging companies have embraced the BFS technology, organizations have invested in many facilities and lead the products through a rigorous testing process to meet the standards. The efforts have now reinforced the reliability of the BFS technology in a wide range of applications.

On a concluding note, the Blow-Fill-Seal technology market will still continue to bring in an evolution in the healthcare and pharmaceutical sector. As the demand for sterile products grows every day, the BFS technology will play a major role in meeting the market needs.

heading: Factors you must consider while Purchasing an FFS Machine
content1: When you’re running a business in the packaging industry, you would have decided to purchase a Form Fill Seal (FFS) machine. While this machine enables the workers to pack more products in fewer shifts, it can reduce the costs considerably. But, when you have a clear idea about what you need to purchase, here’s what you can consider before making a purchase.

qa.a: While every machine has different features, you must choose an FFS machine based on the needs. Vertical FFS machines are capable of filling and sealing liquid and solid products along the automated assembly line. You are sure to expect faster production at a lower operational cost. On the other hand, you can perceive maximum performance when bags need to be formed using a tube of film through a Tubular FFS machine.

qa.q: Select a machine which is safe to use
qa.a: As your team members set up the infrastructure, you must always check how safe it is to use the machine. Think about purchasing a machine which is not too small or too big. In addition, you must also have ample space while using the machine and maintaining it in future. The layout of the machine also matters most. For instance, you need more space when the inline machines are running linearly. However, as the rotary machines operate in a certain manner, they require less space.

In the current era, many FFS machines boast numerous performance features. But, when you have made up your mind to buy a machine, you must be clear about the features that serve to be beneficial. Firstly, you must observe the machine frame construction that can have a considerable impact on the overall performance and its life span. Above all, welded frames are suitable for packaging food items as they don't have any bolts. This prevents the entry of bacteria and spillage of the product.

qa.q: What are the performance enhancement features that you need to look for?
qa.a: As you’re concerned about the performance of the FFS machine, here are the several things that you need to look for.

When you’re loading certain kinds of rolls, you must ensure that there’s sufficient tension. With automatic or manual tracking, you can always ensure that the film is in the right position and it’s easier to fill and seal the product. It is also possible to keep a track through a manual wheel or an automated sensor. Nevertheless, automated tracking is always better because it detects the problems when anything is bound to happen all of a sudden.

The amount of noise the machine makes is directly associated with the size of the space and the place where the machine is installed. If the FFS machine is set up near a residential area, the workers will have to follow specific operating times.

If you are about to reconfigure the machine, then switching the types and sizes of bags can take some time. In such a case, you will need to know the average changeover time before choosing the FFS machine. Moreover, you must also find out whether you will need special tools for the changeover.

When you come across many machines, you will observe that the machine has a human machine interface and a logic controller. While the former component controls the overall operations, the latter component allows the user to enter suitable commands. But, if you are going to adjust the production process, then you have to use the human machine interface.
The sealing system matters most when you’re about to make a purchase. Hence, when you’re selecting an FFS machine, you must ensure that it fills the product under suitable pressure and heat.

The servo driver of the FFS machine is the part that controls numerous components. This leads to the creation of a closed loop system that offers feedback. Such a type of response enables the workers to adjust the machine without any assistance. Moreover, a servo driven mechanism offers more control as compared to the servo driven mechanism.

Hence, you must set aside some time to be aware of certain things. In those instances, you should always look for the pros and cons of everything and then evaluate accordingly. heading: What you need to know about the Injection Stretch Blow Molding (ISBM) process?
content1: The Injection Stretch Blow Molding process is usually referred to as a process which produces high-quality and hollow containers. As the technique blends injection and blow molding, it increases the overall efficiency significantly. You will also perceive superior product properties, and a reduction in the production cost. Hence, the entire process is used for producing PET bottles, which is widely used in packaging pharmaceuticals and products in liquid form. So, let’s check out more about the ISBM process and the critical parameters that need to be controlled.

qa.q: What are the steps in the ISBM process?
qa.a: This process commences with the injection of polymer in molten form in a mold. This molten liquid then solidifies to form a preform. A bit later, the preform is reheated and stretched using a mechanical stretching rod. This step is managed just before the inflation of the preform with air under high pressure. Finally, the process helps to accomplish the desired shape which is further cooled and removed.
Now, let’s take a quick look at the various stages of the ISBM process.

As soon as the plastic resin is injected into the molding machine, it’s melted and injected to form the preform. While the preform has a finished neck, its walls are thick and its size is small. Later, the preform is cooled down so that it solidifies to the desired shape.

After cooling and removing the preform from the injection molding machine, it is led to the blow molding machine. Before the blowing process starts, the preform is heated to a particular temperature. This step ensures optimal viscosity while stretching and blowing the preform. At these instances, it’s essential to control the temperature so that there’s a consistency in the material properties.

At this phase, the heated preform is then kept in the blow mold, and a stretch rod is used for elongating the preform axially. Further ahead, high pressure air is used for the preform’s expansion against the walls of the mold. Radial Blowing along with Axial Stretching, later, ensures the even distribution of material resulting into a lightweight container.

Soon after the preform is blown, the formed bottle is allowed to cool within the mold. On the other hand, the cooling time is dependent on the mold temperature, type of material, and the bottle thickness. After the cooling phase, the container is removed from the machine and the containers are sent for quality checks. The production team also considers removing excess material like the tail if the need arises.

qa.q: What are the critical parameters that control the success of the ISBM process?

qa.a: Many critical parameters need to be kept under control so that the ISBM process sails smoothly.
When the material is chosen, it later determines the quality of the final product.
It’s quite important to regulate the pressure during the injection stage so that there are less imperfections.

Besides injection pressure, it’s also essential to maintain the mold temperature so that there are less chances of premature solidification. Precise temperature also helps proper filling of the mold cavity.
The rod speed during the stretching phase actually impacts the strength of the walls of the container.
To achieve uniformity in the wall thickness and minimize the chances of overstretching, it’s necessary to control the blow pressure.

Finally, the ISBM process certainly serves to be beneficial as compared to the conventional process of blow molding. Towards the end of the production phase, you are sure to present a bottle with improved strength and stiffness. The ISBM process also produces bottles or containers with greater dimensional accuracy. The workers will also be able to produce more bottles with lower production costs.

heading: Designing Standards our team follows for Clean-In-Place Systems
content1: A Clean-In-Place (CIP) system is nothing but a time-saving tool that rinses the food processing equipment as well as piping and washes it without the need of disassembling the entire system. Way ahead, when the experts design the system pretty well, it can maintain sterility and thereby enhance food safety. It also simplifies the cleaning process and reduces the overall downtime. So, when you’re thinking about investing in a CIP system, you must make sure that the design is as per the current trends and quality standards.

qa.q: What are the different design tips we consider for a CIP system?
qa.a: When our team is about to design a CIP system, a few things are taken into consideration.

In the food industry, there is no one-size-fits-all approach for sanitization because some manufacturers roll out food products that can bring in numerous cleaning challenges to overcome. For instance, if the company produces sweeteners and artificial colors, then it may take a long time to wash the system as compared to the one meant for producing sugar-free beverages. So, MicroFab designs CIP systems according to specific requirements and how often the system needs to be cleaned.

qa.q: #2 Balancing between production schedule & system design
qa.a: When you’re about to set up a CIP system, it’s important to know how it can affect the production schedule. Besides, you also have to be aware of the size of the CIP system along with the processing lines, tanks and what needs to be cleaned simultaneously. On the other hand, it’s important to know the required changeover processes when you’re planning ahead. For instance, when your company is producing fruit juices, then it can be easy to switch from flavor A to flavor B. But, when you have to switch back again to the first flavor, then there’s a need for full system cleaning. The burden can further be reduced on the CIP system when the production schedule along with the cleaning procedure is taken into consideration.

If your company dabbles in the production of food items and beverages, then you have to take precautions to mitigate cross-contamination. This point has to be kept in mind when your team is dealing with allergens or switching from one type of food item to another. Most of the time, you will come across facilities that have separate CIP systems for ready to eat food items. Moreover, when you’re concerned about cleaning for allergens, ensure that the chemicals and the water are not used again. This can lead to the spread of allergens across the production line.

qa.q: #4 Minimizing the consumption of water and chemicals
qa.a: When the production facility is running smoothly, water usage can be something that’s very important. But, when you introduce certain methods in the CIP system, it can enhance the product yield, reduce the rinsing time and thereby the use of water. With pigging, you can push a pressurized plug into the production line for blowing air just for clearing the line. A recovery tank can also be set up to reuse the water for the initial rinsing process soon after the final rinse. This can eventually help to save a considerable quantity of water in the CIP system.

qa.q: #5 Ensuring drainage along with adequate flow
qa.a: Depending on the piping size, the CIP flow rate can determine the turbulence in the production line. This enables to improve the cleaning action especially when multiple circuits have to be cleaned at the same time. In addition, the workers may open the drain valves for short bursts during the entire CIP process. Just because of this reason, it is important to place the field drains properly along with the floor drains to prevent the occurrences of flooding. This tip also prevents the operators from getting distracted with direct spraying of water and chemicals.

Finally, our team always considers spatial limitations which can enable them to set up the CIP systems properly. While you plan to set up the CIP system, we also understand the pipe configuration and cleaning compatibility. If elastomers are present in the piping system, then it may get ruined due to certain chemicals. Therefore, we first confirm whether the piping system needs to be upgraded with the existing cleaning solution in mind.
